snippet: Research shows that what people think now that they will want to do in retirement will probably change. The right planning can prepare for that shift.
abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column examines research showing that many people do a poor job of predicting what they will want to do with their leisure time during retirement, making financial planning more difficult; offers advice from experts on how to account for possible shifts in taste when forming a retirement plan.
lead_paragraph: Research shows that what people think now that they will want to do in retirement will probably change. The right planning can prepare for that shift.

headline.main: Saving for Bucket List That’s Likely to Evolve in Years Before Retirement
headline.print_headline: Saving for Bucket List That’s Likely to Evolve in Years Before Retirement
